fields.name: powerSetupValue
fields.description: Power setup value. 0x00: Full power, 0x01: Balanced, 0x02: Interval, 0x03: Aggressive with 1 Hz, 0x04: Aggressive with 2 Hz, 0x05: Aggressive with 4 Hz, 0xFF: Invalid

fields.name: period
fields.description: Position update period and search period. Recommended minimum period is 10 s, although the receiver accepts any value bigger than 5 s. Only valid when powerSetupValue set to Interval.

fields.name: onTime
fields.description: Duration of the ON phase, must be smaller than the period. Only valid when powerSetupValue set to Interval.

issues: This extraction represents the simplified M9/Protocol 30+ version where the period and onTime fields are deprecated/reserved.
Contains a minor OCR typo: 'O' instead of '0' in the description for period/onTime fields.

valid_variations.reason: In later protocol versions (M9 generation), the specific Interval parameters (period and onTime) are moved to the Configuration Interface (VALSET/VALGET) or deprecated in this message, leading to the trailing 6 bytes being marked as reserved.

adjudication.reasoning: The UBX-CFG-PMS message is an 8-byte message across multiple generations. In the M8 generation (Extraction 2), bytes 2-5 are defined as 'period' and 'onTime' to configure the 'Interval' power mode. In the M9 generation (Extraction 1), u-blox moved toward a unified configuration database (VALSET), resulting in these fields being simplified to 'Reserved' in the legacy CFG-PMS message, while maintaining the 8-byte length for backward compatibility. Both extractions are correct relative to their respective hardware generations.
